name: Heimat Games
description:
Welcome to Heimat Games

Heimat Games is a party game for 2-4 players, in which the rural population competes against each other in three different events:

  • Pitchfork Fight - Throw dung at your opponents
  • Tractor Race - Drive your tractor past various obstacles
  • Grab-a-Beer - Carry beer mugs across the road

Choose one of eight villagers, enter your name and your hometown, then let the competition begin!

Features
  • 2-4 player competitive gameplay
  • USB/Bluetooth game controller and keyboard support
  • Authentic 8-bit folk music soundtrack
  • Optional "Scanlines" effect for CRT screen simulation
  • 🇬🇧 English and 🇩🇪 German language options
Local Multiplayer Action

Have your friends come over and play with up to 4 players just like in the old days! The game supports up to 4 game controllers for maximum local multiplayer fun. In case you don't have enough game controllers (or none at all), it is also possible to use the keyboard for control.

This game is a local-multiplayer (or "couch gaming") game. However, using a remote gaming service like "Parsec", it is still possible to enjoy the game with your online friends over the internet.

What is this "Heimat" you're talking about?

"Heimat" is the German word for "home", not in a sense of "house", but more about a sense of region, area, coziness, homeliness. Fun fact: There is no 100% adequate English translation of this word.
